author: dev_guru
text: Just tried an AI agent to build a full-stack app. It's not perfect, but it finished 80% of the boilerplate. The future is here.

author: skeptic_dev
text: These AI agents are just fancy script runners. They can't handle complex logic or custom requirements. Still a long way to go.

author: ProductHuntFan
text: r/programming - Discussion on Devin, the AI software engineer. Is this the end of programming jobs? Some say yes, some say it's just a powerful new tool.

author: startup_founder
text: We used an AI agent to generate our landing page copy and initial user onboarding flow. Saved us about a week of work. Highly recommend for early-stage startups.

author: vc_insights
text: The next billion-dollar company will be built by a founder leveraging a team of AI agents, not human employees. The productivity gains are astronomical.

author: hobby_coder
text: I built a small game using an AI agent assistant. It was great for finding bugs and writing tests, but the core game logic still needed my creative input. It's a collaborator, not a replacement.
